election_record.label: Massachusetts 1809 House of Representatives, Barre

overview.note: "This town has this day voted to send but one Representative. The votes were 288 - of which Major N. Jones, the federal candidate, had 150; and is chosen. We were democratically misrepresented last year. It is to be hoped that democracy has here fallen, never to rise again." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 6, 1809.

election_record.reference: Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). May 6, 1809.
